question: 聞く
sourceAnswer: to{} hear | listen-(e.g.-to-music) | ask/enquire/query | hear-about/hear-of/learn-of | follow-(advice,-order,-etc.)/obey/listen-to/comply-with | hear-(e.g.-a-plea)/grant-(a-request)/accept-(e.g.-an-argument)/give-consideration-to | smell-(esp.-incense)/sample-(a-fragrance) | taste-(alcohol)/try
userAnswer: to{} hear | listen | ask/enquire | hear-about | follow-{advice/order}
activeAnswer: to{} hear | listen | ask/enquire | hear-about | follow-{advice/order}
sourceMnemonic: This word consists of kanji with hiragana attached. Because the hiragana ends with an <ja>う</ja> sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji itself means <kanji>hear</kanji> so the vocab verb version is <vocabulary>to hear</vocabulary>.
sourceReadingMnemonic:
Since this word consists of a kanji with hiragana attached, you can bet that it will use the kun'yomi reading. You didn't learn that reading with this kanji, so here's a mnemonic to help you: 

You need <vocabulary>to hear</vocabulary> something very important, but you can't. In order to hear, you have to take a <reading>key</reading> (<ja>き</ja>) and unlock the doors covering your ears. Go ahead and imagine yourself doing that, focusing on the key.
